document.title: ELA Grade 7 Reading Literature & Informational Dynamic Learning Maps

1C3C988FCBA8465A9EFFFC73A8F0D10F.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

318A14DB6CD54920A0C3692FED8E580C.description: Demonstrate understanding of synonyms and antonyms.

07EB35E954144AD88D605EE86036BFE2.description: Identify the literal and nonliteral meanings of words in context.

635ECA5FF9B447D6BA34F1316CFC4AEA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

2D2A095A0E784AD1A02DE064DC6B6A24.description: Seek clarification and meaning support when unfamiliar words are encountered while reading or communicating.

84311718CDD3470B9CF93F0F704062AF.description: Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and the words that result when affixes are added (e.g., liked, disliked, liking).

1BCE23965703448F93DFDA0696B9F214.description: Use context to determine which word is missing from a text.

53A12CFDB8E24EA0B3E73554CE7AB1AD.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.
a. Use precise language as required to achieve desired
meaning.

081ABD21A63E4513BC0AC6A4BD41B5D5.description: Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of letter-sound relationships and/or common spelling patterns.

5439000976A14C828A2F471CCF056753.description: Use end punctuation when writing a sentence or question.

657E5A5264114AC19CDB5D9A62C2E0E0.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

5B7D98A756404D6B865BF8E0ACB0D6CD.description: Produce complete simple sentences when writing or communicating.

4F37E4883AA34874949D5C9F30A78F4D.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

A652AFE684B44E43A5B6EDB168C88828.description:
Communicate precisely (i.e., provide complete
information) or efficiently (i.e., telegraphic communication) as
required by the context, task, and communication partner.

471CA48976EF4C528147E62B25976F33.description:
Select or create audio recordings and
visual/tactile displays to emphasize specific points in a
presentation.

54B3BFC0823F4EF3B66B50D96A689EDE.description:
Present findings on a topic including relevant
descriptions, facts, or details.

8D4E6016933142688793C2CF23A24B6A.description:
Determine whether the claims made by a
speaker are fact or opinion.

B8796A53D2E144F39EB817849DC8B3B8.description:
Identify details related to the main idea of a text
presented orally or through other media.

E2815D3E0C194D3CA5D03CAEA8901EC9.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others in a discussion.

0CCA8E8CA44F40369EF0AB1610468075.description: Remain on the topic of the discussion when answering questions or making other contributions to a discussion.

2D897BF8A7084D72808E436AF6FDE3B3.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, follow simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

FDADD73A9EBE48E1ABEC9334FB393C15.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

BFE04FA362AF48C59BEDAC5400B40203.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

BBBAE8E650CF448BA7EBA11F161A41AA.description: Apply Essential Elements of Grade 7 Reading Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use relevant and sufficient evidence for supporting the claims and argument.”).

E8313C63A6D849898FB717B139A639C0.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 7 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Recognize the difference
between fictional characters and nonfictional
characters.”).

6DA08A592963433B9C7026C95A348820.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

B478AF9D1B3040CA9309202890C5BE01.description:
Identify quotes providing relevant information
about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

9A33D3037B814897BDEDA787CA023A9F.description:
Conduct research to answer a question based
on multiple sources of information.

AD758BA168C949B7A515321EEBE49A06.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E5031E1EA0004A779E5A7DF714F8D6BB.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing to interact and collaborate with others.

754C582DF5FE41BBA3303CACE0990162.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

63AC5DEE6205418A87B19DDDE928E3A9.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

56A7A9BF20DA470293D49E807EF6F243.description: Use words that describe feelings of people or characters in the narrative.

937B0B842ED647148AC537B3F37BB206.description:
Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal
order.

587A8C8FC8404A9EB8267BA1C9354CBE.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience
introducing the experience, at least one character, and
two or more events.

6CC424055AF44321AA3D235439E358A6.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

E1B2C3605E7A4550938F8B8B1D49B2BE.description:
Select domain-specific vocabulary to use in writing
about the topic.

B3250DB29D504989ADF29726C907EF11.description:
Select domain-specific vocabulary to use in writing
about the topic.

9D9BFB878A6C4A7D902D9024BEB6A1DA.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and
information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

AC3ACE1CAD494BEDBE8E6F46993FB68A.description: Write to share information supported by details.

7238EFA920464D26A7B6372480F68CD4.description: Use temporal words (first, next, also) to create cohesion.

609B0B2DA64841B0BA9784B1DE78F37B.description: Write one or more reasons to support a claim about a topic or text.

CDFB0D14C423461CBF475B5FA07E088B.description: Introduce a topic or text and write one claim about it.

455BC1BEDB05406796E6FC64B225CDC4.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

8A4CA299595F4DE89E6EB70E0F851336.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

C24F18878F974E0D9C1440876D441B98.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

0CEE75109F7C49208CDFCFBE76DF8B4B.description: Compare and contrast how different texts on the same topic present the details.

E3412693448A41E28655008B42A05CF2.description: Determine how a claim or reason fits into the overall structure of an informational text.

61AD99D2DF1A42AFB7A1C564E0447B9E.description: Determine an author's purpose or point of view.

2C20FA3E02AB448CBE0FF15257285AE0.description: Determine an author's purpose or point of view.

1E2C114569C04BA9A1788EFCD872E4F4.description: Determine how a fact, step, or event fits into the overall structure of the text.

B3EFCBF4F23C40ED8C7648166A3FD320.description: Determine how words or phrases are used to persuade or inform a text.

05725F5DAADE459D89A50C94573B1397.description: Determine how two individuals, events or ideas in a text are related.

FDD3915199E34A139E0C7D1F4754AD2B.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text.

4D1EDC380F874E428F2354190856F96D.description: Analyze text to identify where information is explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.

922E4DA5AF3545458EBC75F40D23FFE8.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas, and
poetry.

57492D3D5B034135B4BD3C16E70DB051.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B4938B5EBDDD4A65B79C4188A832D165.description:
Compare a fictional time, place, or character in
one text with the same time, place, or character portrayed in a
historical account.

1300F0E429A3490FADF5D0A2B0317383.description:
Compare a text version of a story, drama, or
poem with an audio, video, or live version of the same text.

1F3E2E59EA6E4BAA934C401516DA2582.description:
Compare the points of view of two or more
characters or narrators in a text.

58D9B7BBD30D431FAC525BFA63E4FC98.description: Compare the structure of two or more texts (e.g., stories, poems, or dramas).

0B2C38D992EE471EB708A646E8D0F7C2.description: Determine the meaning of simple idioms and figures of speech as they are used in a text.

716CC51F33F54147BEFFCC9988822818.description: Determine how two or more story elements are related.

FF654D67471846BD923D7C7F8D38A40A.description: Identify events in a text that are related to the theme or central idea.

239562DABECC403DBAB0EC3EC4F4FBAF.description: Analyze text to identify where information is explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.
